com.aevi.mail

Class MailServiceProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.aevi.helpers.services.AeviServiceProvider<MailService>
      • com.aevi.mail.MailServiceProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class MailServiceProvider
extends AeviServiceProvider<MailService>
    The MailServiceProvider class gives an entry point to initialize a MailService

    After the MailServiceProvider is connected, by using the AeviServiceProvider.connect(com.aevi.helpers.services.AeviServiceConnectionCallback) function, a AeviServiceConnectionCallback is returned containing the initialized service.

    When the service is no longer required it must be disposed by calling the AeviServiceProvider.close() method on the MailServiceProvider.

    The following example demonstrates how to obtain an initialized MailService from an Activity. 

     
 MailServiceProvider serviceProvider = new MailServiceProvider(this);

 serviceProvider.connect(new AeviServiceConnectionCallback<MailService>() {
    @Override
    public void onConnect(MailService service) {
       ...
    }
 });
